item.title: Whitelisting LD_PRELOAD for Fun and No Profit
item.description: If you’ve been around the Linux/BSD/Solaris/Other UNIX ecosystem for a while you’ve probably heard of the fabled LD_PRELOAD trick. If you haven’t heard of it, let me introduce you to one of the longest-held, dirty security issues in UNIX… A Brief Look at LD_PRELOAD LD_PRELOAD is an environment variable used by the dynamic linker on UNIX-based systems. Normally the dynamic linker follows a specified search pattern to load various dynamic libraries (shared objects on UNIX).
